required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Multicenter Study for Early Evaluation of Acute Chest Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Multicenter Study for Early Evaluation of Acute Chest Pain

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, clinical database and blood sample bank of acute chest pain (ACP) will be established at chest pain center of multi-center hospital. To explore new biomarkers and screen clinical indicators with effective risk stratification and prognostic evaluation for ACP through proteomics technology and statistics methods. Risk stratification and short-term and long-term prognostic evaluation models for high-risk ACP will be established using large data analysis.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this study, acute chest pain (ACP) patients will be selected from chest pain center of nine large tertiary hospitals in China from November 1, 2019 to October 31, 2021. All the selected patients will sign the informed consent.
Patients' characteristics, the first vital signs at the time of consultation, the first arterial blood gas, complete blood count, coagulation markers, blood biochemical results and myocardial injury markers, imaging examinations and electrocardiogram will be collected within 30 minutes at admission. Meanwhile, whole blood and plasma samples will be collected and stored in - 80 â„ƒ refrigerator. After diagnosis according to the gold standard examination or related guidelines, patients will be admitted to different department for standard treatment. Medication, surgical procedures and complications will be recorded carefully. Plasma and whole blood will be used to detect proteomics and/or genomics biomarkers associated with early evaluation of ACP.
Screening early evaluation indicators using novel protein biomarkers and easy-to-obtain clinical indicators, and establishing evaluation models for high-risk ACP by data analysis methods. Area under the receiver operating characteristic curves (AUROC), net reclassification improvement (NRI), integrated discrimination improvement (IDI) and decision curve analysis (DCA) will be used to evaluate the prediction ability of the model.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with all-cause death
primary_outcome.description: Patients die of all causes during hospitalization or follow-up

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with cardiovascular death
primary_outcome.description: Patients die of cardiac and cerebrovascular diseases during hospitalization or follow-up

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with major adverse cardiac events (MACEs)
primary_outcome.description: MACEs include cardiac death, stroke, and recurrent myocardial infarction.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with acute myocardial infarction
primary_outcome.description: Chest pain patients are diagnosed as acute myocardial infarction based on fourth edition of guidelines for myocardial infarction

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with acute pulmonary embolism
primary_outcome.description: Chest pain patients are diagnosed as acute pulmonary embolism based on CT of pulmonary angiography.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with acute aortic dissection
primary_outcome.description: Chest pain patients are diagnosed as acute aortic dissection based on CT of aortic angiography.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with acute coronary syndrome
primary_outcome.description: Chest pain patients are diagnosed as acute coronary syndrome based on European Society of Cardiology (ESC) guidelines.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with ischemia or necrosis of lower limbs
secondary_outcome.description: Patients complicate with ischemia or necrosis of lower limbs during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with acute heart failure
secondary_outcome.description: Patients complicate with acute heart failure during hospitalization
Patients receive revascularization for recurrent angina or myocardial infarction during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with consciousness disorder
secondary_outcome.description: Patients complicate with consciousness disorder during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with cardiogenic shock
secondary_outcome.description: Patients complicate with cardiogenic shock during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with acute kidney injury
secondary_outcome.description: Patients complicate with acute kidney injury during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with malignant arrhythmia
secondary_outcome.description: Patients complicate with malignant arrhythmia during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with pericardial tamponade
secondary_outcome.description: Patients complicate with pericardial tamponade during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with multiple organ dysfunction syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: Patients complicate with multiple organ dysfunction syndrome during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with respiratory failure
secondary_outcome.description: Patients complicate with respiratory failure during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of participants with cardiac arrest
secondary_outcome.description: The sudden termination of cardiac ejection function, the disappearance of great artery pulsation and heart sound, and severe ischemia and hypoxia of important organs (such as brain) lead to the termination of life.

other_outcome.description: Time between patient's visit and discharge

arm_group.description: The population in this study are characterized by acute chest pain as the first symptom for consultation within 24 hours.

intervention.description: Acute chest pain patients, suspected acute coronary syndrome, are diagnosed by coronary angiography.
Acute chest pain patients, suspected acute aortic dissection, are diagnosed by gold standard of CTA.
Acute chest pain patients, suspected acute pulmonary embolism, are diagnosed by gold standard of CTA.
All patients with acute chest pain will subject to ECG examination within 10 minutes of admission, which can quickly screen ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction.
Dynamic changes of cardiac troponin I and/or T will be used in the diagnosis of acute myocardial infarction

study_pop.textblock: The population in this study is characterized by acute chest pain as the first symptom for consultation. These are mainly Han and Tibetan patients from southwest China. The study population included first-visit and referral patients.

overall_official.affiliation: Emergency Department, West China Hospital, Sichuan University

facility.name: Affiliated Hospital of Zunyi Medical University
Affiliated Hospital of Southwest Medical University

patient_data.ipd_description: This study will share individual participant data (IPD) including patient characteristics, vital signs, laboratory examinations, imaging examinations, diagnosis, adverse events in hospital and long-term prognosis.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Six months after completion of the test
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: IPD will be public accessable via Electronic Data Capture. (ResMan: http://www.medresman.org.)
